data.title: A way to distinguish open windows on the taskbar
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.8.0-insider
- OS Version: Windows 7 x64

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open a couple of projects.
2. Look at the taskbar.
3. Can you quickly understand which button corresponds to which project?

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/94334/20532948/dddce0ca-b0ec-11e6-8739-cfa8331c2af9.png)

You can't. Because the title has the current file name first, not the project name.

<sub>It'd be funny if VSCode used favicons for the taskbar buttons... :)</sub>

data.title: Test: debug console objects from output
data.body:
- [x] @mjbvz 
- [x] @ramya-rao-a

Complexity: 2

As per https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/15796 we are now supporting expanding complex objects in repl which are coming from output channels. Have a node program, choose `node2` as `type` in 'launch.json', launch your program, open repl and verify:
* You can use `console.log` to print complex objects, these objects can be expanded in repl
* You can use `console.log` with multiple arguments, like `console.log('abc', { d: 123 })`, and they are all visible.

data.title: (feature request) Highlight matching quotes, double quotes and backticks
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.7.1 - OS Version: Win10 x64 Steps to Reproduce: My suggestion is to not only highlight matching square brackets, round brackets/parentheses and curly brackets (`[], (), {}`) as well as matching tags e.g. `
`, **but also quotes, double quotes and backticks,** i.e. `''`, `""` and ` `` `. _The highlighting would be via **underlining** these symbols, in order to visually distinguish them from any matching brackets (which are highlighted with outline (box))._ This is a feature of one of the most popular packages for Sublime Text, BracketHighlighter.
PS. [Template literals (which are quoted via **backticks**)](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Template_literals) are an ES6 feature.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.7.1
- OS Version: OS X 10.11.16

I started using VSCode yesterday and today, the full screen stopped working. Now, when I press the green icon or cmd+shift+f, VSCode window just shakes (seemingly so... looks like the status bar on the bottom just gets re-rendered) and refuses to enter full screen. This one sounds difficult to reproduce... is there somewhere I can get logs to show you all?

data.title: Code gets committed although the pre-commit hook fails
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.8.0-insider (f298203857dd6aebf096cb56de0c30b59e100d34)
- OS Version: macOS 10.12.1 (16B2657)

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Change some code
2. Commit code
3. Code gets committed, but the pre-commit hook fails

Here is the code of the pre-commit git hook:

```
#!/bin/sh

# Redirect output to stderr.
exec 1>&2

if [ "$(git status |sed 's/ *//g'|grep modified:)x" != 'x' ] ; then
  echo '### Changes: Running lint and test to avoid committing errors.'
  npm run test
  echo '### Tested.'
fi
```

When I run the commit command from the shell, the commit is aborted and the code is not committed

`git commit -m "Some stuff here"`

data.title: Duplicated character when typing accented character
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Insiders Build 2016-11-22T07:03:01.551Z
- OS Version: OS X 10.12.2 (16C41b)

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Switch to English (U.S.) keyboard
2. Press `Opt-E`, `E`, `R`.

Expected Result:

Key  | Opt-E |   E   |   R
-----|:------|:-----|:----:
Text |   ´      |   é    |   ér

Actual Result:

Key  | Opt-E |   E   |   R
-----|:------|:-----|:----:
Text |   ´      |   é    |   éér

data.title: Unable to open ... File not found
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.7.0
- OS Version: Ubuntu 14.04 LTS

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Run debugger or unit test that causes a stack trace to be displayed
2. View contents of debug console which look something like:

```
  0 passing (7ms)
  1 failing
  1) /app/models/plant should pass full validation:
     Error: temp
      at Context.it.only (test/app/models/test.plant.js:46:11)
```

Even though the full path to the file is shown in the parens only the part from `/app/` onwards is underlined and when clicked produces "Unable to open 'test.plant.js': File not found (/app/models/test.plant.js). Create File / Cancel"

Also tested on a Mac with same results.

if i press { i would be really faster if a new line would happen, then a tab in the new line and then a } -- but the cursor should stay in the middle of the braces (after the tab). Would be also cool to select text, and if i press { it gets formatted in the Allmanstyle... how could this be achieved??

data.title: Introduce a backup file model inside IBackupFileService
data.body:
This PR introduces a `BackupsFileModel` to `BackupFileService`. It resolves all backups that exist for a workspace on startup and keeps itself updated when changes to backups are made. Thus it avoids the constant disk lookup when resolving files or untitled models (https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/15653)

In addition to that, it associates the `versionId` of the model with the resource that was backed up and thus allows to avoid backing up content of a model that is already backed up (https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/14075).

**Fixes**:
* Avoid checking for backups on each resolve() of file/untitled (https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/15653)
* Hot Exit: backup all ignores existing backups? (https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/14075)

@Tyriar I would think that the `BackupsFileModel` is also the right place of reading the meta data of the backups for https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/15718 to keep everything in one place. Once that is in, `IBackupFileService` should get a method that returns the paths of file and untitled resources that contain backups.

data.title: Ability to Toggle SideBar panels with the same shortcut
data.body:
Not sure if you/others will agree but it would be nice to be able to open (collapsed) SideBar panel (eg. Explorer) and close it with the same shortcut.

I mostly work with hidden Activity Bar and Side bar and when I need for example Explorer for a moment:
1. I press `Cmd+Shift+E` (my hand stays over that key combination)
2. I click the file with second hand and I'm ready to close the panel
3. But pressing the same `Cmd+Shift+E` combination does not toggle/close Panel - I need to switch to `Cmd+B` to close

Maybe additional setting or logic that if panel got open due to shortcut (while hidden) one can close with the same key combinations - seems the most natural

data.title: Intellisense and type checking in Embedded code in markdown
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.7.1
- OS Version: Win 7

Unable to have completion and type checking on embedded typescript code in markdown
```markdown
    ```typescript
    import Person = require("Person");
    var person = new Person("My name");
    console.log(person.name)
    ```
```

It would be also a useful feature to be able to run embedded code

data.title: Caret returns view to its last position after scrolling with Ctrl+Up or Ctrl+Down.

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: Version 1.7.1
- OS Version: Ubuntu 16.04

This is an enhancement request for a setting to emulate the behavior of Sublime Text.

Reproduce:
1. Scroll a multi-line file until you can no longer see the cursor, using the 'Ctrl+Up' or 'Ctrl+Down' keys.
2. Hit 'Up' or 'Down'.
3. The view returns.

My muscle memory expects the cursor to follow the current view.

data.title: code colorization incorrect for SQL
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.7.1 (02611b40b24c9df2726ad8b33f5ef5f67ac30b44, 2016-11-03T13:53:14.822Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 6.1.7601
- Extensions:

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|python|donjayamanne|0.5.2|
|code-runner|formulahendry|0.5.1|
|mssql|ms-mssql|0.1.5|
|PowerShell|ms-vscode|0.7.2|
|vscode-sql-beautify|sensourceinc|0.0.3|

---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open a new file, change language to SQL
2. Enter the following line:

create table #foo(a int, b char)

4. from the hash (number sign) on, the text is presented in green, as if were a comment. but in SQL, a hash does not begin a comment.  Comments either begin with '-- ' (single line) or '/*' (multiline)

data.title: ConfigurationService#lookup is responsible for 25% of startup time
data.body: In the built version of vscode insiders do this: * close all editors * start profiling * reload * stop profiling 🐌 You will find that ~25% of the time is spent doing `lookup`-calls. This is for sure is triggered by [`getEntries`](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/master/src/vs/workbench/services/configuration/common/configuration.ts#L48) but there seems no other way to get all values (effective, default, user, workspace) for all configuration keys. [CPU-20161122T143305.cpuprofile.zip](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/files/606481/CPU-20161122T143305.cpuprofile.zip)

data.title: Git branches don't refresh when you change remote url
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.7.1 (02611b40b24c9df2726ad8b33f5ef5f67ac30b44, 2016-11-03T13:46:00.226Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 16.0.0
- Extensions:

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|html-snippets|abusaidm|0.0.18|
|vscode-twig-pack|bajdzis|1.0.0|
|python|donjayamanne|0.5.2|
|Angular2|johnpapa|1.0.2|
|vscode-todo-parser|minhthai|1.8.3|
|vscode-icons|robertohuertasm|4.0.2|
|sass-indented|robinbentley|1.2.1|

---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create a project with a git repository.
2. Push your repository to remote (github or bitbucket e.t.c) 
3 . Change remote url e.g `git remote set-url origin https://github.com/USERNAME/OTHERREPOSITORY.git`
4. Check branches on vs code. (they will not have refreshed)
5. Restart vs code and repeat step 4. (they still will not have refreshed)

data.title: Cannot browse extensions gallery behind corporate proxy
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.7.1
- OS Version: Windows 10 Build 14393

This is another issue related to access the extensions gallery behind a proxy. I read all previous post here and on the web but I was not able to find a fix for my environment.

I tried to setup proxy in settings without authorization
```
    "http.proxy": "http://proxy_address:8080",
    "https.proxy": "http://proxy_address:8080",
    "http.proxyStrictSSL": false
```
and I tried also with authorization, that is usually required by our corporate proxy (BlueCoat)
```
    "http.proxy": "http://domain%5Cusername:password@proxy_address:8080",
    "https.proxy": "http://domain%5Cusername:password@proxy_address:8080",        
    "http.proxyStrictSSL": false
```
In both in this case the error message : **Error read ECONNRESET**

The very strange thing is that with Visual Studio 2015 Enterprise I can browser the extensions.
I decide so to monitor the HTTP traffic using WireShark but I was not able to find the differences the two call looks very similar but in case of VS Code the connection is dropped, in the other case it works.

I checked the two destination addresses and I can open both in HTTPS without problem with the browser on the same machine.

### WireShark Monitoring VS Code Extension Gallery HTTP Request

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1030305/20521185/47acf88e-b0aa-11e6-81d3-a302605ed89d.png)

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1030305/20521188/4bdb0e3c-b0aa-11e6-917c-b3251af56de7.png)

### WireShark Monitoring Visual Studio 2015 Extension Gallery HTTP Request

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1030305/20521192/50a69d82-b0aa-11e6-9623-a42d361b790d.png)

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1030305/20521196/556f5c64-b0aa-11e6-9b29-33bc383f46c5.png)

If you have some suggestions or you need some more debug information just let me know.

Thank you,
Marco

data.title: Test snippet variables
data.body:
Tests #4956

* [x] any os @roblourens 
* [x] any os @ramya-rao-a

Complexity: 2

We have added support for well-known variables in snippet land. Make sure variables are available for static snippets and for snippet strings inserted by completion item providers. Available variables are described here: https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/master/src/vs/editor/contrib/snippet/common/snippet.md#L13

data.title: Test SnippetString completions
data.body:
tests https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/3210

* [x] any os @isidorn 
* [x] any os @ramya-rao-a

Complexity: 3

We allow completion providers to insert snippet strings as completion items. Make sure that

* we support the syntax described here: https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/master/src/vs/editor/contrib/snippet/common/snippet.md#L2
* you can insert snippet strings only as primary edit
* the snippet string has helpful builder methods
* the new API sufficiently documented
* you can insert snippet string independent of it `kind`
